title: Blackbody - effect of one-third r and 2T on power

content.prompt: A star is modeled as a spherical blackbody. The star evolves over time, with its radius decreasing to one-third of its original value while its absolute surface temperature doubles. What happens to the power radiated by the star, and how do the changes in radius and surface temperature account for the change in the power?

choices.label: The emitted power increases. The decrease in radius has a greater effect than the increase in temperature.
The emitted power increases. The increase in temperature has a greater effect than the decrease in radius.
The emitted power decreases. The decrease in radius has a greater effect than the increase in temperature.
The emitted power decreases. The increase in temperature has a greater effect than the decrease in radius.
